                                                                               â€“3â€“                                            M22/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


Subject Details: Chemistry higher level Paper 2 Markscheme
Candidates are required to answer ALL questions. Maximum total = [90 marks].
1.    Each row in the â€œQuestionâ€ column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.
2.    The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the â€œTotalâ€ column.

3.    Each marking point in the â€œAnswersâ€ column is shown by means of a tick (âœ”) at the end of the marking point.
4.    A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by â€œmaxâ€ written after the mark in the â€œTotalâ€ column.
      The related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
5.    An alternative word is indicated in the â€œAnswersâ€ column by a slash (/). Either word can be accepted.
6.    An alternative answer is indicated in the â€œAnswersâ€ column by â€œORâ€. Either answer can be accepted.
7.    An alternative markscheme is indicated in the â€œAnswersâ€ column under heading ALTERNATIVE 1 etc. Either alternative can be accepted.
8.    Words inside chevrons Â« Â» in the â€œAnswersâ€ column are not necessary to gain the mark.
9.    Words that are underlined are essential for the mark.
10.   The order of marking points does not have to be as in the â€œAnswersâ€ column, unless stated otherwise in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
11.   If the candidateâ€™s answer has the same â€œmeaningâ€ or can be clearly interpreted as being of equivalent significance, detail and validity as
      that in the â€œAnswersâ€ column then award the mark. Where this point is considered to be particularly relevant in a question it is emphasized
      by OWTTE (or words to that effect) in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
12.   Remember that many candidates are writing in a second language. Effective communication is more important than grammatical accuracy.
13.   Occasionally, a part of a question may require an answer that is required for subsequent marking points. If an error is made in the first marking point
      then it should be penalized. However, if the incorrect answer is used correctly in subsequent marking points then follow through marks should be
      awarded. When marking, indicate this by adding ECF (error carried forward) on the script.
14.   Do not penalize candidates for errors in units or significant figures, unless it is specifically referred to in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
15.   If a question specifically asks for the name of a substance, do not award a mark for a correct formula unless directed otherwise in the â€œNotesâ€
      column. Similarly, if the formula is specifically asked for, do not award a mark for a correct name unless directed otherwise in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
16.   If a question asks for an equation for a reaction, a balanced symbol equation is usually expected, do not award a mark for a word equation or an
      unbalanced equation unless directed otherwise in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
17.   Ignore missing or incorrect state symbols in an equation unless directed otherwise in the â€œNotesâ€ column.
                                                                                                   â€“4â€“                   M22/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

(Question 4 continued)

      Question                                       Answers                                                     Notes                      Total

 4.     e         ALTERNATIVE 1                                                                Accept valency.
                  Property: variable oxidation state âœ”                                         Accept for second statement â€œMg
                  Comparison: Mn compounds can exist in different valencies/oxidation states   Â«alwaysÂ» has the same oxidation
                  AND Mg has a valency/oxidation state of +2 in all its compounds âœ”            stateâ€.

                  ALTERNATIVE 2
                  Property: coloured ions/compounds/complexes âœ”
                                                                                               Accept Mn forms coloured
                                                                                               ions/compounds/complexes and Mg
                  Comparison: Mn ions/compounds/complexes coloured AND Mg ions/compounds
                                                                                               does not.
                  white/Â«as solidsÂ»/colourless Â«in aqueous solutionÂ» âœ”                                                                       2
                  ALTERNATIVE 3
                  Property: catalytic activity âœ”                                               For any property accept a correct
                  Comparison: Â«manyÂ» Mn compounds act as catalysts AND Mg compounds do         specific example, for example
                  not Â«generallyÂ» catalyse reactions âœ”                                         manganate(VII) is purple.
                                                                                               Do not accept differences in atomic
                                                                                               structure, such as partially filled d sub-
                                                                                               levels, but award ECF for a correct
                                                                                               discussion.

                                                                                                    propanol.                                     1

                  AND                                                                                                                             1
                  Ï€: 1 âœ”

5.     b    i

                                                                                                                                                  1

                                     âœ”

5.     b    ii    carbocation formed from (CH3)3COH is more stable / (CH3)3C+ is more stable than   Do not award any marks for simply
                  (CH3)2CHCH2+ âœ”                                                                    quoting Markovnikovâ€™s rule.

                  Â«because carbocation hasÂ» greater number of alkyl groups/lower charge on the

(Question 6 continued)
      Question                                         Answers                              Notes                    Total

 6.     a    iv    X-ray crystallography âœ”
                                                                                                                      1

 6.     b    i
                   HNO3 + 2H2SO4          NO2+ + H3O+ + 2HSO4- âœ”            Accept â€œHNO3 + H2SO4          NO2+ +
                                                                            H2O + HSO4-â€.
